remarks: A vector belonging to both a subspace and the span of the singleton of a vector not in it must be zero.  (Contributed by NM, 17-Dec-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement: elspansn5 $p |- ( A e. SH -> ( ( ( B e. ~H /\ -. B e. A ) /\ ( C e. ( span ` { B } ) /\ C e. A ) ) -> C = 0h ) ) $.
